Episodes.Title: Out of Town
Episodes.Plot: In the third-season opener, Salvatore and Don take a business trip out of town. Pete Campbell and Ken Cosgrove worry about the changes at Sterling-Cooper and how the changes will impact them.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,drug use and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Joseph Culp, Bryan Batt, Ryan Cartwright, Brynn Horrocks, Michael Gaston, Sunny Mabrey, Jack Kehler, Julie McNiven, Orestes Arcuni, Kelly Huddleston, Annie Little, Joel Lambert, Jamie Elman

Episodes.Title: Love Among the Ruins
Episodes.Plot: Don's father-in-law pays a visit to his daughter's family. Peggy works hard on a campaign while the firm tries to decide if they will accommodate an unusual request from a client. Elsewhere, Roger plans a wedding.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,drug use and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Bryan Batt, Talia Balsam, Ryan Cutrona, Embeth Davidtz, Eric Ladin, Abigail Spencer, Elizabeth Rice, Kevin Cooney, Alexa Alemanni, Derek Ray, Brian Carpenter, Billy Finnigan, Jeremy Scott Johnson

Episodes.Title: My Old Kentucky Home
Episodes.Plot: The writers make an attempt to stave off late-night boredom during a mandatory overtime session. Roger throws a party as Joan and Greg host their own party. Sally has a run-in with Grandpa.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,drug use and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Bryan Batt, Ryan Cutrona, Peyton List, Sam Page, Chelcie Ross, Laura Regan, Miles Fisher, Jud Tylor, Judy Kain

Episodes.Title: The Arrangements
Episodes.Plot: Don and his father-in-law cross paths. Meanwhile, Peggy is in search of a new roommate; and a rich new client is excited to be doing business with the firm.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,drug use and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Bryan Batt, Ryan Cutrona, Eric Ladin, Carla Gallo, Aaron Stanford, Ryan Cartwright, Crista Flanagan, Sarah Drew, Audrey Wasilewski, Alexa Alemanni

Episodes.Title: The Fog
Episodes.Plot: Sally's behavior causes concern for Don and Betty. Betty has an eye-opening dream that has a strange effect on her. Pete tries to work a new business angle in his dealings.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,drug use and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Bryan Batt, Mark Moses, Ryan Cutrona, Abigail Spencer, Matt Bushell, Anne Dudek, Yeardley Smith, Alexa Alemanni

Episodes.Title: Guy Walks Into an Advertising Agency
Episodes.Plot: Sterling Cooper receives a surprise visitor; Sally has been spooked by something (or someone); and Joan receives some shocking news.

Episodes.Title: Seven Twenty Three
Episodes.Plot: Betty tries her hand at local politics. Don is forced into thinking about the future. Peggy receives a luxurious gift.

Episodes.Title: Souvenir

Episodes.GuestStars: Chelcie Ross, Anne Dudek, Mark Metcalf, Julie McNiven, Nina Rausch

Episodes.Title: The Gypsy and the Hobo
Episodes.Plot: A former client makes a return; Betty and her kids go on a trip; and Joan and Greg make plans for their future.

Episodes.Title: The Grown-Ups

Episodes.Title: Shut the Door. Have a Seat
